content_text:
Policy ID: P-001
Policy Title: Data Quality and Accuracy Policy
Policy Owner: Chief Data Officer
Policy Statement: National Banking Corporation shall maintain deposit account records meeting 99.5% accuracy standards as measured by quarterly data quality assessments.
Scope: All deposit accounts subject to FDIC Part 370
Related Regulations: 12 CFR Part 370.3(b)
table_data: National Banking Corporation shall maintain deposit account records meeting 99.5% accuracy standards as measured by quarterly data quality assessments.
All deposit accounts subject to FDIC Part 370
parent_heading: P-001: Data Quality and Accuracy Policy

content_text:
Control ID: C-001
Control Description: Validate account opening data against source documents within 24 hours of account creation.
Control Type: Preventive
Control Owner: Operations Manager
Testing Frequency: Quarterly
Evidence: System validation logs, exception reports
table_data: Validate account opening data against source documents within 24 hours of account creation.

content_text: The covered institution must be capable of supporting deposit insurance calculation within twenty-four (24) hours following failure of the institution. This capability must be demonstrated through annual testing and certification to the FDIC.

Joint accounts (JNT) require the CI to maintain a signature card for each joint account with the signature of each co-owner. Each co-owner is insured up to $250,000 for their ownership interest in all joint accounts at the same institution.

A covered institution means an insured depository institution that has two million or more deposit accounts. The FDIC was established in 1933 to maintain stability and public confidence in the nation's financial system. This regulation applies to all covered institutions.

Risk ID: R-001
Risk Description: Data quality issues may result in inaccurate deposit insurance calculations
Inherent Risk Rating: High
Residual Risk Rating: Medium
Risk Owner: Chief Risk Officer
Mitigation Controls: C-001, C-002, C-007
table_data: Data quality issues may result in inaccurate deposit insurance calculations
parent_heading: R-001: Data Quality and Completeness Risk

content_text: Each legal entity customer must identify beneficial owners with 25 percent or more ownership interest. Documentation must include government-issued photo identification for all beneficial owners. Records must be updated within 30 days of any ownership change.

Data completeness rate must meet or exceed 98.5% for all required fields in the deposit insurance determination file. Missing or incomplete records must be flagged and remediated within 5 business days.
